Introduction: The Nuclear Medicine Technologist(NMT) is the healthcare professional who is able to cover the whole range of NM procedures in the clinical routine. The period of Education is a fundamental part of the educational process and for this purpose considerable resources investment is dedicated to it. The possibility of knowing how to confront the most varied situations in Italy(I), in 27 European(EU) and Mediterranean nations, determines a professional growth in the sector. Aim: The NMT is an important part of a team of healthcare specialists; the aim of this work is to identify NMT formative processes, working situations and economical capacities. In I, Education and training is quite similar than in EU: during the initial months of the university course(average 3 years), NMTs acquire the basic theoretical elements, follow the courses which help to develop didactic, then anatomy, pathology, equipment in the radiology area(60%); at the end, NMT deals with other fields of application of the ionizing radiations. The range of tasks permitted of NMT varies from country to country, and there is considerable overlap with other professional groups. Results: According to several published reports, there are approximately 90000radiological+NM technologist in the world; 60000 of them in Europe (25%men+75%women). There are 1500 NMTs operating throughout Italian NM-PET departments. In addition to historical/cultural traditions, differences in teaching and the characteristics of university course programming create different technical procedures in NMT routine (diagnostic imaging, radiation protection, etc.); legislation is relative flexible in all countries, with 24-40 working hours per week with additional extramural NMT activity; the duties of Chief-NMT are always dedicated to management of logistic problems(80%) and financial resources(20%). Credit points must be collected by the exam for CE sessions in every countries. Italian NMT salary is 1.5 times lower than 80% of EU. Professional benefits (extra days off or special bonus) are taken into account only in the Mediterranean area or intercontinental countries. Conclusions: the training and the professional qualification of NMT represents a first step towards a governance of healthcare working activities; it's important to underline main NMT goal: one high standard of work for NMT in countries. Fundamental for the changeover of NMTs is the ability to acquire/process SPET&PET-CT images, in addition to performing quality control of NM technologies. It's in the interest of healthcare quality that NMTs take responsibility for providing of high quality service and performance in clinical routine, with professional competence and global competition. Introduction: Assuming that the modern concept of a Nuclear Medicine Department should ideally include a Positron Emitting Tracers (PET) production facility, there is a need to optimize the design of an integrated facility (here considered as the opportunity to build from the beginning) in order to allow the distinct patterns of functioning and circulation (patients, public, professionals, products, ) to occur in an harmonious and most efficient way. The purpose of this study is to integrate the ultimate concepts concerning aspects so crucial as radiation protection, ergonomics and the practicability and efficiency of the Unit, considered as a whole. Material and Methods: Starting with a bibliographic review, done according to the most recent developments on regulations and legislation, essentially at international level but also regarding eventual national particularities and following with practical knowledge, obtained from recent (real) implementation of similar units -and information shared by the responsible entities -we aim to build a complete and structured project, with an objective planning (blueprints), able to serve as basis for real implementation of an unit with an updated and optimized integrated vision of the current production and diagnostic processes. Results and Conclusions: The final blueprints of the Unit are based on studies concerning not only the previous research on current legislation, but also the current assumption of best practices and fundamental principles related to radioprotection (as the ALARA principle), production (as the cGMP rules) and diagnosis (International Guidelines). These blueprints demonstrated the practical result of that research and consist, briefly, on the obtained optimal structuring of the diagnostic side of the unit (as well as the production side) combined together in order to facilitate the necessary interaction, even if maintaining its respective independence and individual protection (compulsory condition to assure best practices) even in case of simultaneous operation.

On SPECT images, Tl-201 accumulation grade was 1 in all 21 cases. On both planar and SPECT images, patterns of change in Tl-201 accumulation were constant in all 21 desmoid-type fibromatoses. Conclusion: Tl-201 scintigraphy is useful for diagnosis of desmoid-type fibromatoses and evaluation of recurrent lesions. SPECT images are helpful for detecting tumors when Tl-201 accumulation is not detected in the tumor on planar images.

Aim of the study: To correlate the neuropsychiatric symptoms of degenerative dementias with perfusion alterations in specific Brodmann areas of the brain cortex. Material and Methods:89 patients participated in the study, coming from an outpatient Memory Clinic. All of them had a neuropsychological evaluation with a battery of tests. The neuropsychiatric symptoms were measured by the Neuro-Psychiatric Inventory(NPI). 39 patients received the diagnosis of Fronto-temporal Dementia(FTD), 22 that of Alzheimer's disease(AD), 4 of Parkinson Dementia, 8 of Lewy Body Dementia and 16 of Amnestic Mild Cognitive Impairment who later developed AD.

FIGREF114.text: Cognitive Impairment: a follow up study with 99mTc-HMPAO SPECT and neuropsychological tests S. Nuvoli 1 , A. Nieddu 2 , A. Rotondo 2 , E. Rubattu 1 , R. Salvo 2 , M. E. Solinas 1 , F. Chessa 1 , A. Spanu 1 , G. Madeddu 1 ; 1 Nuclear Medicine DPT, University of Sassari, Sassari, ITALY, 2 Geriatrics DPT, Policlinico Sassarese, Sassari, ITALY. Aim: Mild Cognitive Impairment (MCI) represents a transitional clinical condition preceding early dementia (D) needing correct follow-up since D clinical signs can develop. We evaluated whether 99mTc HM PAO brain SPECT and neuropsychological test (NT) combined use may be reliable in MCI follow-up. Material and Methods: We studied 31 patients aged 41-82 yrs, 18 F and 13 M, with MCI clinical signs. CT and/or MRI: cortical and/or subcortical atrophy in 15 patients and gliosis in 5. All patients underwent the NT MMSE and DemTect and 99mTc HMPAO (740 MBq) SPECT. Results: MMSE was normal in 26/31 patients and positive for D in 5/31. DemTect was normal in 7/31 patients and positive in 24/31 (15 D and 9 MCI); it was concordantly positive with MMSE for D in 2 patients, classified as MCI 1 patient positive at MMSE and was negative in further 2 MMSE positive patients; DemTect identified 21 patients missed by MMSE. Both NT were negative in the remaining 5 patients. SPECT showed bilateral temporo-parietal defects in 29/31 cases, 8 of whom classified as D by NT. SPECT showed focal defects in another patient only positive at DemTect for MCI and was negative in the remaining one affected by depression, concordantly with both NT. All 15 DemTect positive D patients and the 3 MMSE positive cases underwent donepezil therapy, while the other 13 patients, including 8 MCI at DemTect and 5 negative NT (one with normal SPECT) were monitored for 24-36 mths without treatment. FIGREF141.text: Assessment of Regional GABA-A ReceptorBinding Using 18 F-fluoroflumazenil Positron Emission Tomography in Spastic Type Cerebral Palsy without Periventricular leukomalacia on MRI J. Lee 1 , H. Park 1 , E. Park 1 , D. Kim 1 , D. Rha 1 , T. Kim 1 , J. Jeong 2 , C. Park 1 ; 1 Yonsei University College of Medicine, Seoul, REPUBLIC OF KOREA, 2 Seoul National University Hospital, Seoul, REPUBLIC OF KOREA.Objective: Periventricular leukomalacia (PVL) due to hypoxic ischemic insult to the immature brain, chorioamnionitis and maternal infection are the major etiological factors of spastic type cereral palsy (CP). In this study, cerebral gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA)-A receptor PET imaging using [ 18 F]-fluoroflumazenil (FMZ) was performed in 5 patients(mean age 10.6±4.09 years old, 3 males and 2 females) with spastic diplegia type CP without obvious PVL on conventional MRI, and compared with those of normal control (n=10, 8 males and 2 females, mean age 21±2.2 years ) to investigate the role of the GABAergic inhibitory neurotransmission in the pathogenesis of abnormal motor function in CP. Methods: The Gross Motor Function Classification System (GMFCS) scales were measured in the patients. Diffusion tensor imaging with tractography was performed to evaluate the connectivity of the pyramidal tract. The PET data were acquired for 20 minutes 20 minutes after injection of approximately 5.5 MBq (0.15 mCi)/Kg of [ 18 F]-FFMZ in 3-D mode to avoid nonspecific GABA A receptor binding. [ 18 F]-FFMZ-PET images obtained from the patients and controls were compared using Statistical Parametric Mapping (SPM) software.

FIGREF150.text: Close Head Trauma. D. Cabello García 1 , M. Bellón-Guardia 1 , R. Vilar-López 2 , C. Ramos-Font 1 , M. Gallego-Peinado 1 , A. Santiago-Chinchilla 1 , I. Bravo 3 , Á. Horcajadas-Almansa 4 , P. Aalcazar 5 , M. Pérez-García 2 , M. Gómez-Río 1 , J.Llamas-Elvira 1 ; 1 Medicine Nuclear, Virgen de las Nieves Hospital, Granada, SPAIN, 2 Neuropsychology Department, Granada University, Granada, SPAIN, 3 Emergency, Virgen de las Nieves Hospital, Granada, SPAIN, 4 Neurology, Virgen de las Nieves Hospital, Granada, SPAIN, 5 Radiology, Virgen de las Nieves Hospital, Granada, SPAIN Introduction:In absence of structural changes, functional studies as SPECT brain imaging of regional cerebral blood flow (SPECT·rCBF) or neuropsychological testing (NP) could asses the evaluation of patients affected of Post-Concussion Syndrome (PCS) after a mild close head trauma (MCHT), especially in litigation (Lit) and if malingering (Mal) is suspected. The aim of this study is to evaluate the possible relationship between the results obtained in the clinical examination, SPECT· rCBF and NP findings. Methodology: SPECT-rCBF ( 99m Tc-ECD) and NP (Victoria Symptom Validity Test, Test of Memory Malingering) were studied in the next groups. A) patients with PCS six months after MCHT without changes in structural imaging just after the injury or during the PCS, subdivided according: A 1 ) Nor to be involved in any PCS-related litigation (PCS·NLit) (n= 28); A 2 ) PCS patients involved in PCS-related litigation negative for neuropsychological malingering tests (PCS·Lit Mal-) (n=13); A 3 ) PCS-related litigation but positive for these tests (PCS·Lit Mal+) (n=8); and B) group of promoted analogs malingerers (AN)(n=27). SPECT-rCBF was assessed globally (0-5) and considering changes in anterior or posterior pole (0/1); NP were considered positive/negative for malingering. Results: Global score was different (p<0.005) between analogous malingerers and PCS, and similar inter PCS subgroups. Proportion of changes in posterior pole was similar in all groups. Changes in anterior pole was more frequent (in decreasing proportion) in SPC-Lit Mal+(50%) than SPC·NLit (32.1%) (n.s.); similar to SPC·Lit Mal-(30.8%) (ns), but clearly superior than AN (3.7%)(SPC vs AN p<0.005). Conclusions: In comparison with promoted analogs malingerers, patients with PSC showed changes in both, global SPECT-rCBF and in anterior pole. Instead of a paradoxical elevation in the proportion of anterior changes at PCS·Lit Mal+, there is not a definitive pattern to differentiate SPC true patients from malingerers.P42 -Monday, Oct. 15, 2007, 2:30 pm -4:00 pm, Poster Area Radiopharmacay/Radiochemistry -Technetium P320 Comparison for quality assurance of Tc-99m activity measurements with radionuclide calibrators K. FIGREF158.text: .C.O.M. spa Advanced Center Oncology Macerata, Montecosaro, ITALY, 2 University of Camerino, Camerino, ITALY. Aim To evaluate PET imaging of Copper 64 [64Cu]Ethhylenedicysteinenitroimidazole ([ 64 Cu]NNEC-NIM), an interesting copper compound .The copper complexes have much interest as delivery agent for radioactive copper in new copper compound and for functional metabolic imaging potentialities. Material and Methods The [ 64 Cu]ethhylenedicysteine-nitroimidazole ([ 64 Cu]NNEC-NIM) can be synthesized at room temperature starting from NNEC-NIM and 64 Cu(CH 3 COO) 2 . Decay-corrected radiochemical yields based on 64 [Cu] Copper were 80% ± 5% (n=10). Copper 64 [ 64 Cu]NNEC-NIM was determinated at Radio-Thin-Layer Chromatography to have a radiochemical purity of 90%. The amount of agent injected for high performance liquid chromatography was 10 μCi. The specific radioactivity was calculated to be 1mCi/μg. Results To determinate biodistribution [ 64 Cu]NNEC-NIM was injected through the tail vein in tree groups of five swiss Albino mice each (male) 30-35 g. The animal were sacrificed by cardiectomy under slight ether anaesthesia at predetermined time intervals (1, 4 and 16 h.). The organs of interest were excised, wighed and the radioactivity counted in gamma counter. The Micropet studies were excuted using a Yappet System (ISE) after 1 hours, 4 hours and 16 hours after injection. Through micropet analyse we have compared Micropet Images of the animal group injected [ 64 Cu]NNEC-NIM, indicated as group 1, and the animal group injected [ 18 F]fluoromisonidazole (FMISO), indicated as group 2. Conclusions MicroPET imaging studies in nude mice have evidenced similarities between [ 64 Cu]NNEC-NIM and [ 18 F] FMISO, and study findings supported the potential use of [ 64 Cu]NNEC-NIM as a functional imaging agent.

FIGREF172.text: Filtration Rate (GFR) (51Cr-EDTA) in Paediatric Oncology B. Martínez de Miguel, E. Martínez Montalbán, S. Blanco Herrero, P. García Miguel, G. Riesco Almarza, L. Martín Curto; Hospital Universitario La Paz, Madrid, SPAIN. The dosing of carboplatino used in Neuroblastoma's treatment, must be based on the renal function determined by GFR in all the patients with a target value of Area under the curve (AUC) of 4.1 mg/ml.min/day. High doses of Ifofosmamide used in Rhabdomiosarcoma and Ewing's Sarcoma treatment produce renal damage. Aim: To asses the usefulness of GFR's calculation for the dosing of chemotherapy in bone marrow pre-transplant of Neuroblastoma and its nefrotoxicity in Ewing's Sarcoma and Rhabdomiosarcoma. Material and methods: A total of 37 patients have been studied distributed in three groups: Group I: 10 patients ranging in age 2 to 13 years diagnosed of Neuroblastoma. The Carboplatino doses were calculated, in Hemato-oncology department. It was obtained by half life of elimination of 51 Cr-EDTA (t ½) and the body weight (B.W.) of the patient, by means of the Newell's formula. Group II: 10 patients ranging in age 3 to 15 years diagnosed of Rhabdomiosarcoma treated with Ifosfamide's high doses. Group III: 10 patients ranging in age 2 to 23 years diagnosed of Ewing's Sarcoma, treated with Ifosfamide's high doses. Results: The average values were: Group I: B.W.: 19.41 kg. GFR: 49.31±24.48 ml/min Normalized GFR (GFRN): 143.6 ± 73.14 ml/min. t½: 87.8±23.9 min Group II: GFR: 62.83±39.21 ml/min, GFRN: 116±35.08 ml/min, B.W..:30.8 kg Group III: GFR: 66.7± 38.9 ml/min, GFRN: 94.8± 36.5 ml/min. B.W..: 43.29 kg. Conclusion: The 51 Cr-EDTA method can determine the right dose of Carboplatino in order to reach an AUC of 4.1 mg/ml.min/day by the body weight and the value of the half-life of elimination of 51 Cr-EDTA. This dose limits the variation of predictable values of AUC based on the guideline of traditional dosing. The calculation of the GFR with 51 Cr-EDTA seems to be very useful in the follow-up of the renal function after the administration of high doses of Ifosfamide. FIGREF204.text: Gastrinoma: Long-term Results of a Phase IIA Clinical Trial F. Iten, B. Müller, H. R. Mäcke, J. Müller-Brand, M. A. Walter; University Hospital, Basel, SWITZERLAND. Aim: We aimed to explore the efficacy of [90Y-DOTA]-TOC therapy in metastasized gastrinoma. Methods: In a phase IIA trial, we investigated response, survival and long-term safety profile of systemic [90Y-DOTA]-TOC treatment in metastasized gastrinoma. Adverse events were continuously recorded and graded according to the criteria of the National Cancer Institute. Survival analyses were performed using multiple regression and Kaplan-Meier models. Results: 23 patients (12 females, 11 males, median age: 49.6 years) were prospectively enrolled. A median cumulative activity of 12.4 GBq (range: 6.1 -46.6 GBq) [90Y-DOTA]-TOC was administered. The median survival was 11.8 month (range: 1.6-60.2) from first [90Y-DOTA]-TOC treatment and 47.1 month (range: 13.8-471.9) from diagnosis. Response was found in 8 participants (34.8%) and there was a trend towards longer survival from time of diagnosis in responders to [90Y-DOTA]-TOC therapy (Hazard ratio: 2.4, p=0.29). No permanent hematologic toxicity arose. Conclusions: In patients with metastasized gastrinoma, [90Y-DOTA]-TOC therapy represents an effective treatment option with a low toxicity profile. FIGREF251.text: Can the serum levels of prostate-specific antigen predict the need of bone scan in patients with newly diagnosed prostate cancer?E. Trivizaki 1 , V. Moschogiannis 1 , D. Tsigalakis 2 , L. Iordanidou 1 , S. Saranti 1 , A. Georgakopoulos 1 , K. Rethimniotakis 1 , K. Diamantakis 1 , P. Koutsiouba 1 ; 1 Department of Nuclear Medicine, "Metaxa' s" Cancer Hospital, Piraeus, GREECE, 2 Biochemical Department, Piraeus, GREECE.The indication of bone scan in patients with early diagnosed prostate cancer is in close relationship with the levels of serum prostate-specific antigen. The aim of this study is to determine the rate of positive bone scans in patients with low serum PSA and to evaluate if the various levels of PSA could predict the need of bone scan in those patients. Material and method: we reviewed the records of 118 patients (median age 71,5 years, range 42-89) with untreated newly pathologically diagnosed prostate cancer. Whole body scans with Tc-99m MDP were performed to all patients and their PSA was estimated within 30 days of the scan. The patients were divided in four groups according to their PSA levels. Group I: pts with PSA 4 ng/ml. Group II: pts with PSA 5-9 ng/ml. Group III: pts with PSA 10-20 ng/ml. Group IV: pts with PSA 20 ng/ml. The findings of the whole body scans were compared with the levels of serum PSA. Results: The bone scan was positive in 43 pts ( 36,4 %) of 118 patients. In particular: 5 pts. ( 11,6 %) of group I 4 pts. ( 9,3 %) of group II 10 pts. ( 23,2 %) of group III 24 pts. ( 55,8 %) of group IV.

MIBI SPECT after nitrate administration can predict functional myocardial recovery.P47PET imaging for differentiation diagnosis of dilated cardiomyopathy from ischemic cardiomyopathy in patients with cardiomegaly and heart failure D. V. Ryzhkova, M. K. Kornushina, L. A. Krasilnikova; Federal Agency, St.-Petersburg, RUSSIAN FEDERATION. LV ejection fraction less than 40%) were included in the study. None of them had left bundle branch block. We excluded patients with congenital, valvular and pulmonary heart diseases and diabetes. The patients were divided into two groups. The ICP group included 32 patients (male/female 27/5, age 55,1±6,7years) with 75% or greater stenosis of at least one major coronary artery by the results of X-ray or MSCT-coronary angiography. The DCP group included 18 patients (male/female 17/1, age 49,8±8,6years) with angiographically normal coronary arteries, 6 of them had alcohol abuse. All patients underwent PET with [13N]ammonia and [18F]-FDG for evaluation myocardial perfusion and metabolism. A semiquantitative analysis of the images was performed by the polar map method. Results: All patients with ICP showed large and severe perfusion abnormalities that distributed along the coronary artery territories. Perfusion/metabolism match was revealed in all (100%) patients with ICP and perfusion/metabolism mismatch was observed in 25 (79%) patients of the same group. The patients with DCP had diffuse heterogeneity of myocardial perfusion. 5 patients with DCP showed small and mild perfusion defects with non-segmental distribution. The areas of abnormal perfusion were significantly larger in ICP than in DCP. Perfusion/metabolism match was noted in 2 (11%) patients with DCP and none of the patients with DCP showed perfusion/metabolism mismatch. Conclusion: PET imaging with [13N]-ammonia and [18F]-FDG is useful for differentiating of dilated cardiomyopathy from ischemic cardiomyopathy in patients with cardiomegaly. Diffuse heterogeneity of myocardial perfusion, non-segmental distribution of perfusion defects and lack of perfusion/metabolism mismatch are the most important features for distinction of dilated cardiomyopathy from ischemic cardiomyopathy.

Simpson method was used to calculate EF in ECHO. All of the examinations carried out during a week. EF was 7% higher in ECHO than MUGA, according to B&A analysis. The agreement limits were +35.2 and -21.4. Conclusion; although significant difference was observed between ECHO and MUGA, further analysis between ECHO-GSPECT and between MUGA-GSPECT revealed good correlations and agreements. TABREF28.text: Aim: Head and Neck Cancer suggest a group of tumors with generally aggressive behavior. CT and MRI techniques had a significant role on staging and restaging of Head and Neck tumors. The aim of the study was to evaluate the role of 18 F-FDG PET in the first PET/CT center in Greece in the initial diagnosis, and management of patients with Head and Neck cancer. of them MRI was performed just before PET/CT evaluation. Results: Group A: In 17/18 patients (94.4%) had positive findings on PET/CT (SUV: 7.02±4.46), while 1/18 (5.6%) presented negative findings (suffered from benign tumor). From 13 patients who underwent CT, five (38.5%) had match findings with PET/CT. In 7/13 patients (59.8%) PET/CT scan outbalanced CT, while 1/13 (7.7%) had positive CT and negative PET/CT. Five patients underwent MRI and PET/CT. Both techniques revealed positive findings. In two of five patients (40%) there were match findings between MRI and PET/CT. In 3/5 (60%) PET/CT scan outbalanced MRI. Group B: In 41/43 patients (95.3%) positive results were observed in PET/CT (SUV: 11.According to the results of this study the conclusion is that PET/CT scan presents a plain superiority in effectiveness over the CT in both Group A and Group B. The same outcome stands for the PET/CT in comparison with MRI, although in Group B there have been two false negative results.

TABREF29.text: Aim:To explore the method and quality control of 18F-radiolabeled the effective element (ZMS) of anemarrhena (18F-FZMS). Methods: Firstly the tosyl-ZMS was synthesized. ZMS was dissolved in dry pyridine and sulfonyl chloride which was dissolved in dichloromethane was added with constant stirring in ice bath (0°C) for 2h and then at room temperature for 72h, and the tosyl-ZMS was checked by 1H-NMR and MS. Radiolabeled product [18F] FZMS was prepared by fluorination of the tosyl-ZMS with [18F] KF and kryptofix 2.2.2. The labeled product was analyzed by HPLC on a reverse-phase C18 column, and eluted with 100% acetonitrile at a flow rate of 0.3 ml/min. Contents and analytical methods of quality control for 18F-FZMS were investigated and the main quality criteria were achieved through strict control of the determining parameters by standard procedures. Results:The tosyl-ZMS was obtained in 51.23% yield. Radiochemical yield was 20~44.11% (corrected for decay). Synthesis time was 50 to 70 min with radiochemical purity >95%, and average specific activity of 69.3GBq/mmol. All quality criteria of 18F-FZMS met the requirements of the positron radionuclide-radiolabeled pharmaceuticals.Conclusion:18F-FZMS injections can be used to further study in the animal or human study.

TABREF33.text: Scanning F. Cinaral, M. Halac, S. Sa er, S. Yılmaz, E. Erdogan, N. Ergul, S. Mut, C. Onsel, H. Sayman, K. Sonmezoglu, B. Kanmaz, L. Kabasakal, I. Uslu; Department of Nuclear Medicine,Cerrahpasa Medical Faculty, Istanbul University, ISTANBUL, TURKEY. FDG PET/CT scanning is being used widespread for the evaluation of malignant diseases. Incidental malignant thyroid lesions can be detected by PET in patients with no previous history of thyroid pathology. Our purpose was to figure evaluate the clinical importance of the focal FDG uptake in thyroid gland. Material and Methods Totally 7445 Patients with various malignant diseases who had FDG PET/CT scanning (Siemens LSO HIREZ PETCT) between January 2005-December 2006 were included in the study. Fortyseven patients without previous history of thyroid disease/pathology showed focal FDG uptake in the thyroid gland. In 35 of them histopathologic verification was performed. Results Thyroid malignancy was detected in 10 (28.6%) of the 35 patients that underwent FNAB. The final histopathology revealed papillary carcinoma in 7 patients, follicular variant papillary carcinoma in 2 patients and metastatic carcinoma in 1 patient. Conclusion Incidental focal thyroid uptake is rarely seen in FDG PET/CT scanning. However there's risk of malignancy in a reasonable number of these cases. We conclude that incidental uptake of thyroid in FDG PET/CT has a considerable risk of malignancy. To confirm it histopathologic verification should be the next step. Zhang 1 ;1  The First Affiliated Hospital, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, CHINA, 2 Huashan Hospital, Fudan University, Shanghai, CHINA. To evaluate the diagnostic value of PET and PET/CT for recurrent ovarian cancer.Methods Data about PET and PET/CT for recurrent ovarian cancer were EMBASE),OVID database from January 1990 to December 2006,and China National Knowledge Infrastmcture (CNKI) from 1994 to 2006. The inclusion of qualified literatures was based on the criteria for diagnostic research recommended by the Cochrane Methods Group on Screening and Diagnostic Test.Statistical analysis was performed by employing the softwares of MetaDisc 1.4 and SAS8.0.Results In total, sixteen articles were extracted, among which 10 articles were studied on PET, and 6 on PET/CT. The fixed model was selected to calculate the pooled weighted sensitivity, specificity and lnDOR as 86.4%, 91.8% and 3.877 on the PET studies,and the area under the curve of SROC was 92.3%; The random model was selected to calculate the pooled weighted sensitivity and specificity as 90.9%,85.3% and 3.304 on the PET/CT studies,and the area under the curve of SROC was 97.0% . Z test between PET and PET/CT studies showed there was no significant statistical difference (P>0.05). Conclusions With relatively high sensitivity and specificity,PET and PET/CT may be a useful modality in the clinical diagnosis of recurrent ovarian cancer.Value of 18F-methyl-Choline PET to monitor ProstateCancer response to Docetaxel Treatment R. TABREF50.text: Comparison of TC-99m Hynic-Toc and Hynic-Tate Octreotid Scintigraphy with FDG-PET and MIBI in Thyroid Cancers Have Local Recurrences or Distant MetastasesS. Sager, L.Kabasakal, M. Halac, N. Ergul, B. Kanmaz, K.  Sonmezoglu, H. Sayman, C. Onsel, I. Uslu; Cerarhpasa, Istanbul,  TURKEY.   :  There are a lot of conventional radiologic modalities for an early diagnosis of distant metastases or local recurrences of thyroid cancers. The aim of the this study was to evaluate the clinical utility of Tc-99m Hynic-Toc and Tc 99m Hynic-Tate, new octreotid derivatives, to detect recurrences or distant metastases in I 131 negative Tg positive thyroid cancers and comparison of the lesions with FDG-PET and MIBI studies in the same patients. Material and Methods: The study population comprised 36 patients (9 male, 16 female), age range 13-78 years with a mean of 53,4±14,6 and histologically confirmed that 16 patients medullary thyroid cancer, 18 patients papillary thyroid cancer and 2 patients follicullary thyroid cancer. All patients underwent on whole body scanning 1 and 4 hours after injection and SPECT imaging was performed from the sites of suspicion. Then we compared the lesions in Hynic-Toc and Hynic-Tate studies with MIBI and FDG-PET studies. Results: Twenty four patients studies were evaluated as true positive (66.6 %) and 11 patients studies were evaluated as false negative (30.5%) in Hynic-Toc and Hynic-Tate studies. In 36 patients the total number of the lesions in Octreotid scintigraphy was 69. 24 of 32 patients FDG-PET study was true positive (78.1%) and false negative in 8 patients (21.9%). The total number of the lesions in FDG-PET was 99. In 36 patients MIBI study was positive in 18 patients (50%) and negative in 18 patients (50%). The total number of the lesions in MIBI was 37. Conclusions: Technetium labelled somatostatin receptor analogs Hynic-Toc and Hynic-Tate are useful imaging alternative in somatostatin receptor expressing thyroid cancers. Radiolabelling is easy and they are readily available for routine use.N. Aide, T. Franson, O. Switsers, S. Bardet; Nuclear Medicine Department,Centre François Baclesse, Caen, FRANCE.

TABREF53.text: Serum biomarker Ca 15-3 and bone scintigraphy pathological findingsA.Koljevic-Markovic, 1964  .1  , E. Krajnovic-Jaksic 1 , Z. Neskovic-Konstatitnovic 2 ; 1 National Cancer Research Center, Belgrade, SERBIA, 2 Institute of Nuclear Medicine KCS, Belgrade, SERBIA.Aim: The aim of this study was to evaluate the correlation of CA 15-3, bone scan and complementary imaging methods (Rtg, Ct and MRI) in follow up of breast cancer patients for positive bone scan findindgs. Material & Method: 33 patients with histologicaly proven breast cancer were included (mean age 59, range 32-81) and followed for having positive bone scan findings. Information was confirmed with other imaging methods: Rtg, Ct, and MRI. Ca 15-3 values were measured in the same time with the bone scan, using the same commercial test over the follow-up period. Bone scan were classified as solitary hot spot lesion (group 1), two lesions (group 2), three lesions (group 3), multiple 3 metastatic involvement (group4). Results: Number of patients in groups 1 to 4 were: 15, 1, 1, 16 respectively and mediana Ca 15-3 value U/ml: 32, 10, 15, 57. Nine patients had normal Ca 15-3-values in spite skeletal metastases. Metastatic involvement: pulmo, liver, skin was respectively 27.8%; 27.8%, 5.6% in group 1 and 11.8%; 35.3%; 5.9% and brain 5.9% in group 4. The statistical difference was evident in groups 4 vs. 1+2+3 (p<o.o1) (Mann-Whitney test). Skeletal metastases were radiologicaly confirmed in 16 patietns (48%): multiple metastatic bone scan were in 50%; solitary lesion in 46% Conclusion: Normal Ca 15-3 value does not exclude bone metastasis, and cannot be helpful in confirming solitary lesions. It has excellent specificity, and is good predictor of a progressive disease, during follow up period. Bone scan pathological findings require careful radiographic evaluation, for early diagnosis.

TABREF55.text: ). Methods: 151p operated on for breast cancer from June 2000 to October 2006 were included in the study. Average age was 53.82 years (29-81), and lymphadenectomy was performed in all cases because of a positive sentinel node biopsy. 99mTc-colloid and a gamma detecting probe (Europrobe®) were used for the sentinel node detection; histopathological analysis: haematoxylin-eosin staining, inmunohistochemistry and PCR. Factors analysed: size of the metastases in the SN and number of patients with metastases. 3 groups of patients were stablished depending on the size of the metastases in the SN: A/ < 2mm; B/ 2 < GC < 5mm; C/ > 5mm. The probability of finding AM1 depending on the size of the metastases of the SN has been studied, as well as the presence of other relating factors: number of positive SN (1, >1), tumoural grade, peritumoural vascular invasion (PVI) and tumoural size. The _2 test was performed or Fisher when convenient to compare categorical variables, and a multivariate conditional logistic regression for data sets was performed to identify the risk profile of metastases presence. Results: 10% of the group A patients (3/31p), 28% of the group B (19/67p) and 52% of the group C (27/52p) presented AM1. The patients with > 1 positive SN presented significantly (p=0.048) more AM1 (50%) than the patients with only one positive SN (30%). 56% of the patients with PVI presented AM1 versus 26% of the patients without PVI (p=0.001). The tumoural grade and the tumoural size don't seem to have any influence in the number of patients with AM1 (p>0.05). The number of positive SN (OR 3.27, CI 95% 1.37-7.65) and size of metastases (OR2-5 4.14, CI 95%1.07-15.98; OR>5 10.42, CI 95% 2.67-40.69) are statistically associated to the presence of metastases independently of PVI, grade and tumoral size. Conclusion: In the Group of patients studied the probability of finding M1 was statistically related to the size of the SN metastases and the number of positive SN, independently of PVI, grade and tumoral size. R. RUANO 1 , M. RAMOS 2 , M. IGLESIAS 2 , A. MARTIN 1 , J. GONZALEZ-ORUS 2 , Y. DOMINGUEZ 1 , J. R. GARCIA-TALAVERA 1 ; 1 NM Dept., Univ. Hosp. of Salamanca, SPAIN, 2 GENERAL SURGERY Dept., Univ. Hosp. of Salamanca, SPAIN.Background: according to the standard indication for the sentinel node detection in breast cancer T1-T2<3cm axillary lymph node dissection can be avoided up to 70% in palpable lessions and up to 80% in non-palpable lessions. It is the aim of this study to present our experience in the therapeutic approach of the SLN biopsy in patients with breast cancer T>3cm without clinical evidence of axillary metastasis. Methods: this is a retrospective study of 431 cases of breast cancer in the period 2001-2006 divided in group A (58 patients) with T>3cm and negative clinical axylla and group B (373 patients) with the conventional indication T<3cm. In all cases lymphoscintigraphy was performed after peritumoral injection of 99mTc-colloidal rhenium sulphide (nanocis); the sentinel node was located with a gamma ray detection probe (europrobe) and periareolar isosulfan blue dye (lymphazurin). Axillary lymph node dissection (LND) was completed only when the SLN was positive for metastasis or not located. Results:Table 1. Sentinel lymph node detection rates in T> 3cm clinical N0.In 2 cases the SLN was not detected and axillary lymph node dissection was performed being positive for metastasis. Micrometastasis was found in the SLN in 5 cases performing axillary dissection in 4 of them showing no additional metastasis. 2 cases showed isolated tumoral cells in the SLN postoperative analysis and LND was not performed.Table 2. Histopathology results in groups A (T>3cm) and B (T<3cm). This table does not include the 2 cases not detected, 2 with isolated tumoral cells in the SLN, and 1 SLN micrometastasis without LND).

Giorgetti 1 ; 1 Nuclear Medicine Dept., Verona, ITALY, 2 University and General Hospital, Verona, ITALY. lymph node (SLN) method and sentinel lymph node biopsy (SLNB) has gained a widespread use, owing to its reliabity in axillary staging with minimal morbidity in patients (pts) affected by T1 breast cancer. Aim: To detect the incidence of axillary lymph node metastases in those pts with negative results at SLNB who not undergone complete axillary lymph node dissection (ALND) and to estimate the overall recurrences in all other pts. Method: From May 2000 to June 2006, a total of 614 women, with preoperative diagnosis of T1 breast cancer (552 cases with unifocal or multifocal/multicentric invasive carcinoma; carcinoma in situ in 62 cases) and negative clinical and echografical examination of axillary lymphatic basin, performed SLN research at our institute (with subdermal or periareolar injection of 37 MBq of 99mTc-nanocoll). After 20-24 hours they underwent SLNB and surgery of the primitive breast lesion. ALND was avoided in all cases with negative results at SLNB (Group A: 497 pts, 81%), among the remaining pts with positive SLNB (Group B: 117 pts, 19%) 101 cases were submitted to a complete ALND. To have a minimum followup (FU) of two years we enrolled 362 pts, who performed surgery till December 2004.

TABREF58.text: Methods: From 1998 to 2005, 151 high risk DCIS patients from six clinical centres were included in a prospective SN database. Results: The conversion rate to invasive carcinoma was 39%. 10 of 142 (7%) successful SNB showed a positive SN (8 micrometastic). SN was positive in 1 % of pure DCIS, in 5.5% of DCIS with microinvasion, and in 19.5% of invasive carcinoma. Clinical presentation was closely related with conversion to invasive carcinoma.

TABREF59.text: Comparison of Intratumoral versus Peritumoral injection of 99m-Technecium radiocolloids for SentinelNode Biopsy in non-palpable breast cancer M. Solá, A. Mariscal, M. Fraile, E. Bulliu, F. J. Julian, V. Vallejo, E. Calvo, F. Fuste, A. Pérez; Hospital Universitari Germans Trias i Pujol, Badalona, SPAIN.Objectives: The study investigates the differences between two approaches for radiolabeled tracer intratumoral and peritumoral administration, in lymph node deteccion in patients with non -palpable breast cancer. Materials and methods: This prospective, randomized study included patients with non-palpable breast cancer and no axillary lymphadenopathy undergoing primary surgical treatment. The patients were randomized into two groups: group INTRA (intratumoral route, n= 35) and group PERI (peritumoral route, n= 45). Patients with clinical or ultrasound sospicious nodes and fine-needle aspiration biopsy node positive were excluded. Results: Intratumoral injection yielded a sentinel node detection rates of 97.1% (34/35) as compared to 84.4 % (38/45) for peritumoral injection. Tracer migration to the sentinel node failed in 8 cases (1 for group INTRA and 7 for PERI). In 21.9% of cases, sentinel nodes were found in an extra-axillary location (11/59 by group INTRA and 16/64 by PERI). Conclusions: Axillary and extra-axillary sentinel node detection was not statistically different between intra-or peritumoral injection approaches. However, the identification rate for the intratumoral route was higher and the difference approached statistical significance.

Golebiewska, B. E. Chrapko, A. Nocun, J. Zaorska-Rajca, A. Kurylcio, W. Polkowski; Skubiszewski Medical University of Lublin, Lublin, POLAND. of the study: The purpose of this study was the evaluation of a risk of lymphatic metastases to the sentinel node (SN) in reference to the number of lymphatic drainage pathways from primary site of malignant melanoma (MM) and localization of the SN in cases of multiple directions of lymphatic drainage. Material and methods: Lymphoscintigraphy was performed in 98 pts with MM (33 females and 65 males), ranging in age from 25 to 79 yr. The Breslow thickness was 0.75-13.0 mm. Tc-99m Nanocolloid (dose activity: 37.0 MBq) was administered in four intracutaneous injections around the scar of MM excision. Subsequently surgical removal of all the SN(s) was performed. Results: The localization of the primary MM sites were: the trunk-47 (48.0%) pts, the lower extremity-33 (34.0%) pts and the upper extremity-18 (18.0%) pts. In 62 (63.0%) pts with a single lymphatic drainage pathway, the SN was metastatic in 18 (29.0%). In the group of pts with multiple lymphatic pathways (36 pts), the SN was metastatic in 11 (30.5%) cases. Conclusions: Considering obtained results, it can not be concluded, that the risk of metastases from the primary site of MM to the SN in patients with multiple lymphatic pathways is higher than in cases of only one pathway. Metastatic changes in more than one sentinel node in the same patient were found in low percentage of cases.

TABREF117.text: for the diagnose of Helicobacter pylori (HP) infection. The aim of our study was to assess the relationship between HP infection and obesity in adult patients with dyspeptic symptoms. Material and Methods: One hundred sexteen patients (73 female, 43 male; mean age 42 years, age range 20-75 years) with dyspeptic symptoms were included in the study. Gastric biopsies, (14)C UBT, IgA and IgG Helicobacter pylori antibodies were obtained in all of patients. The HP infection status was determined by (14)C-UBT. Weight and height were recorded and body mass index (BMI) was calculated. Obesity was defined as BMI of 30 kg/m 2 or greater. Relation between HP positivity and obesity was evaluated. Results: The overall prevalence of HP infection was 76.7%. HP infection were detected in 77% and 75% of patients with BMI less than 30 kg/m 2 and BMI 30 kg/m 2 or greater, respectively. There was no relationship between HP infection and obesity. The endoscopic findings were gastritis (79.3%), erosive gastritis (6%), esophagitis (6%), normal (4.3%), duodenitis (3.4%), and duodenal ulcer (0.9%). Histopathology was positive for H pylori in the 39 patients. Conclusion: It is concluded that no relationship between HP infection and obesity in adult patients with dyspeptic symptoms.Benefit of scintigraphy with autological in vivo labelLed red blood cells for assessment of the site of bleeding in small bowel. Scintigraphy with tagged RBCs is noninvasive diagnostic modality for assessment of source of bleeding in the small bowel. Scintigraphy with tagged RBCs is only complementary to push-enteroscopy or intraoperative enteroscopy. Material and Method: a retrospective study was accomplished of 35 patients (16 men, 19 women, aged 12-91, mean 56 years) who had gastrointestinal bleeding (obscure-overt bleeding) and underwent scintigraphy with in vivo tagged autological RBCs by means of 99m technetium in last 8 years. All our patients had negative endoscopy of upper tract and large bowel.

TABREF119.text: P553 Clinical and Pathological Factors related to 18F-FDG-PET (PET) positivity in the diagnosis of Recurrence and/or Metastasis in patients withDifferentiated Thyroid Cancer (DTC) M. A. Muros 1 , D. Esteva-Fernández 1 , M. Gallego 1 , A. Santiago-Chinchilla 1 , T. Muros 1 , E. Torres-Vela 2 , J. M. López-Ruíz 1 , A. Ramírez 1 , J. M. Llamas-Elvira 1 ; 1 H.U. Virgen de las Nieves, Granada, SPAIN, 2 H.U. San Cecilio, Granada, SPAIN. : To analyze the relationship between a positive PET result and clinical and tumour findings in DTC patients with suspicion of recurrence or metastasis during the follow-up. To determine the diagnostic validity of PET in patients with elevated serum thyroglobulin (Tg) and negative 131 I whole-body scan (WBS) in the follow-up.Material and Methods: Retrospective study was conducted of 50 DTC patients (39 females and 11 males, mean age 39'4 ± 18 years) who had been treated for papillary Ca. (n=39) or follicular Ca. (n=11) with total thyroidectomy and ablation with 131 I. The routine protocol during the follow-up included 131 I whole-body scan (WBS). Thyroxin treatment was withdrawn (4 weeks) and patients were on an iodine-free diet before the WBS. Thyroglobulin (Tg), anti-Tg antibodies, FT 3 , FT 4 and TSH were determined. Patients with negative WBS and elevated Tg were subjected to a 18 F-FDG-PET study one week later. TSH values were always >50 μUI/ml and antithyroglobulin antibodies were negative. PET findings were verified by pathology report or other imaging techniques (CT, MRI, ultrasound). We studied the relationship between tumour variables (histological type, size, multifocality, capsular invasion, lymph-node and/or metastatic involvement) and clinical report variables (age at diagnosis, sex, Tg levels, accumulated iodine dose, recurrence time) and PET findings (chi-square test). Results:Tumour size (p<0.05) and capsular invasion (p<0.05) were significantly related to a positive PET study. The relationship of PET findings with thyroglobulin levels and age at diagnosis was close to significance. PET detected disease in 32/39 patients (82% sensitivity); it was negative in 7/11 of cases without confirmed disease (64% specificity). Positive predictive value was 89%. Conclusions: -Pathological factors such as tumour size and capsular invasion were significantly related to a positive PET study. thyroglobulin levels and age at diagnosis were close to significance. -18 F-FDG-PET is useful in the follow-up of DTC patients with negative WBS and elevated thyroglobulin .Correlation of Thyroid Functions, Urinary Iodine Excretion, Tc-99m Pertechnetate and I-131 Uptakes in Patients with Multinodular Goiter after Mandatory IodinizationA. Cengiz, B. Karayalcin, R. Sari, S. Ozdem, A. Boz, U. Karayalcin; Akdeniz University School of Medicine, Antalya, TURKEY. : The aims of this study are 1. to evaluate the association between urine iodine levels and thyroid Tc99m pertechnetate uptake (TcPU) levels in multinodular goiter (MNG) patients, 2. to evaluate TcPU levels in euthyroid, subclinical and clinical hyperthyroid patient groups, 3. by comparing TcPU and I-131 uptake levels to decide whether TcPU can be used instead of I-131 uptake. Materials and methods: 24-74

TABREF120.text: Aims: correlation between thyroid uptake of F-18-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) and thyroid function or presence of thyroid antibodies were studied. Patients and Methods: serum concentration of TSH, FT3, FT4, anti-TPO and anti-Tg were measured in 105 consecutive patients admitted to oncological (except thyroid gland) FDG PET examination. SUV of thyroid gland were measured. Results: In 88 out of 105 cases thyroid function was normal. 4 patients had subclinical hyperthyroidism, 10 patients had subclinical hypothyroidism and 3 patients had clinical hypothyroidism. The SUV (mean+/-SD) of the thyroid was significantly elevated in patients with hypothyroidism (1,46+/-0,92 vs. 1,05+/-0,06). SUV of FDG was significantly elevated in patients with elevated anti-TPO (1,43+/-0,66 vs. 1,07+/-0,13) or with elevated anti-Tg (1,84+/-0,84 vs. 1,04+/-0,08) serum level as well. In euthyroid patients a negative correlation between SUV and FT4 concentration (r=-0,29, p<0,05) was found. Conclusions: thyroid FDG uptake is higher in patients with high serum concentration of antithyroid antibodies. Diffusely increased FDG-uptake might refer to autoimmune thyreoiditis. Explanation of the inverse correlation between FDG uptake and FT4 concentration in subjects with normal thyroid function needs further studies.Scintigraphic visualization of the "blocked" thyroid I. TABREF121.text: Persistent Papillary Thyroid Carcinoma M. Urhan 1 , A. Mavi 2 , G. Acikgoz 3 , S. J. Dadparvar 3 , A. Alavi 3 , s. J. Mandel 4 ; 1 GATA Haydarpasa Training Hospital Nuclear Medicine, Istanbul, TURKEY, 2 Yeditepe University Nuclear Medicine, Istanbul, TURKEY, 3 Hospital of the University of Pennsylvania Nuclear Medicine, Philadelphia, PA, UNITED STATES, 4 Hospital of the University of Pennsylvania Endocrinology,Metabolism and Diabetes, Philadelphia, PA, UNITED STATES.Aim: Local persistent disease is associated with a significant morbidity and mortality in differentiated thyroid carcinoma patients. Localizing the tumor sites accurately may allow the removal of diseased tissue by surgical intervention and lead a favorable prognosis. In this study we present the findings obtained from various diagnostic modalities in detecting the persistent disease in thyroid bed and neck with regard the role of FDG PETin patients with papillary thyroid carcinoma. Method: Thirty-nine patients (31 female, 8 male; age range 18-80 yrs) were included in the study. The patients underwent radioablation following thyroid surgery 6 months-14 years previously. None of them was proved to have any distant metastases. All patients had serum thyroglobulin (Tg)/Thyroglobulin antibody measurements, 123 I radioiodine whole-body scanning, 18 F-fluorodeoxyglucose positron emission tomography ( 18 FDG-PET) ultrasound of the neck (US) and US-guided fine needle aspiration biopsy (USguided FNA) of the lesions suspicious of being tumor tissue detected in the neck. Results: Infiltration by thyroid cancer cells was noted in 48 of 64 of the specimens extirpated.

TABREF123.text: Correlation of 99mTc-MIBI Scintigraphy and Ultrasound in Detecting of Hyperactive Parathyroid GlandsI. Gerqari, 1 , N. Rizvanolli, 1 , R. Miftari, 2 , L. Abdullahu, 2 ; Diagnostika plus&University Clinical Center of Prishtina, Prishtina, Kosova,UNMIK, SERBIA AND MONTENEGRO. : In the last years, diseases of parathyroid glands have become the most common endocrinological disease. Causes of hyper secretion of PTH are within parathyroid gland (Primary hyperparathyroidism) or outside the gland due to hypocalcaemia (Secondary hyperparathyroidism).In 85% a single adenoma is the cause of primary hyperparathyroidism (HPT), multiple adenoma 6%,hyperplasia 7% or carcinoma 2%.While the Secondary HPT can be caused by renal or gastrointestinal disorderes.Scintigraphy and ultrasound are the most frequently used methods for the diagnosis of parathyroid glands in primary and secondary hyperparathyroidism. The aim of this study was to compare the sensitivity in detecting of hyperactive parathyroid glands using 99mTc-MIBI scintigraphy and ultrasound in correlation with high PTH level and other biochemical analysis like Ca CA ++,with patients proven clinically for primary or secondary hyperparathyroidism. Materials and methods: Eighteen patients (15 female and 3 male with mean age of 45 years, range 17-65 years) with suspicion on primary or secondary hyperparathyroidism were included in this study.Dual phase scintigraphy (including imaging of the neck and mediastinum) was performed after injected dose of 18-20 mCi of 99mTc-MIBI for 10 min. and 120 min. after, with LEHR and Pinhole collimator.In all patients was performed ultrasound of the neck, serum parathormon and Ca, Ca++ as well. Results: The parathyroid 99mTc-MIBI scintigraphy was positive in 15 patients (83.3%), in two of them was identified ectopic adenomas in mediastinum, 7 were with focal hiperacumulation (adenomas), in one patient was registred the multiple gland adenomas and finally in 5 of them we had the hyperplasic parathyroid tissue. The ultrasound was positive in 13 (72.2%)patients.Two of negative ultrasound were ectopic adenomas.Three of negative scintigraphy were with high level of PTH. All the patients were referred for the surgeon. Conclusion: This small study suggest that parathyroid scintigraphy with 99mTc-MIBI have a higher sensitivity particularly with ectopic adenomas.Thyrotropin Concentration In Healthy SubjectsCorrelates With The Peak Systolic Velocity S. Gaberscek, K. Zaletel, E. Pirnat, S. Hojker; University Medical Centre, Department for Nuclear Medicine, Ljubljana, SLOVENIA.

Palestro 2 ; 1 Medical University of South Africa, Pretoria, SOUTH AFRICA, 2 Long Island Jewish Medical Center, New Hyde Park, NY, UNITED STATES. : This retrospective investigation was performed to analyze the utility of the 3 phase bone scan (3PBo) for diagnosing infection of lower extremity joint replacements. Methods: Preoperative 3PBo studies, consisting of flow, blood pool, and delayed (bone) images of 135 failed lower extremity joint prostheses (86 hip and 49 knee) were reviewed by one nuclear physician who had no knowledge of the results of other tests or final diagnoses. The triad of periprosthetic hyperperfusion, hyperemia, and increased periprosthetic activity on delayed bone images was interpreted as positive for infection. Imaging results were compared with the final diagnoses which were based on surgical, histopathological, and microbiological results for all 135 prostheses. Results: 59 (44%) prostheses were infected: 31 knee & 28 hip replacements. Final diagnoses in the remaining 76 prostheses were: aseptic loosening (n=59), failed liner/insert (n=9), prosthetic component malposition (n=3), and other (n=5). TABREF130.text: Tc-Labeled Antigranulocyte Monoclonal Antibody Fab' Fragments (Leukoscan) in Detecting Focus of Fever of Unknown Origin.A. Gaudiano, P. Santoro, A. Pisani, N. Merenda, I. Montemurro, A. Niccoli Asabella, D. Rubini, G. Rubini; Nuc. Medicine, Bari, ITALY. : Most patient with fever of unknown origin (FUO) are affected by common disease that manifest themselves with atypical clinical manifestations, making diagnosis difficult. The aim of our retrospectively study is to verify the utility of 99m-Tc-labeled antigranulocyte monoclonal antibody Fab' fragments (Leukoscan) to identify the focus of FUO. Material and methods: We studied 19 patients (13 men, 6 women; 50+/-5 years) with FUO (body temperature > 38.3 °C during three week). 8 of them came at our observation with a clinical suspected: 2/19 with clinical suspected of arthroprosthesis infection, 1/19 with clinical suspected of a surgical suture infection on thigh, 1/19 a MR evidence of meningomyelitis, 1/19 with clinical suspected of atypical form of Kawasaki syndrome, 2/19 with clinical suspected of spondylodiscitis; 1/19 had scapular-humeral arthralgia; 11/19 came at our observation with no clinical suspect. 16/19 patient showed an increase of erythrocyte sedimentation rate at first hour (ESR > 20 mm/h); 14/19 showed an increase value of C reactive protein (CRP > 0.3 mg/dl); only 4/19 patient had an increase of white blood cell (WBC > 10. 000 * mm 3 ); 2/19 patient did not show increase of ESR, CRP and WBC. All patients underwent imaging 6 and 24 hours after injection of 740 MBq of Leukoscan. We acquired total-body scan and segmentary scan. Results: Only 4 patients of 19 had positive results. The patient, with clinical suspected of spondylodiscitis, had increased uptake in L3 and photopenic lesion in L2 and adjacent soft tissue (ESR: 55 mm/h; CRP 5.7 mg/dl; WBC 6.000 mm 3 ); the patient with surgical suture on the medial side of the thigh had increased uptake in the same side of the surgical suture (ESR 98 mm/h; CRP 14.41 mg/dl; WBC 15.000 mm 3 ); the patient with scapular-humeral arthralgia had increased uptake in the left scapular-humeral articulation (ESR 30 mm/h; CRP 0.1 mg/dl; WBC 8.000 mm 3 ); in one patient with no clinical suspect increased uptake in the joints was shown (ESR 99 mm/h; CRP 14.34 mg/dl; WBC 15.800 mm 3 )

back_matter.text: The main component of paint thinner used in industry is toluene. Toluene can diffuse into many body fluids and tissues; and causes formation of reactive oxygen species (ROS) which are the main agents responsible for cellular damage. Antioxidant enzymes such as SOD, GSH-Px and CAT are part of the natural cell defense system against ROS mediated injuries. Matrix metalloproteinases (MMPs) play an important role in physiologic and pathologic processes, including extracellular matrix turnover, tissue degradation and repair, cell migration and inflammation. An imbalance between the expression of MMPs and tissue inhibitor of metalloproteinases (TIMPs) is believed to cause some pulmonary inflammatory diseases. Especially, the imbalance between MMP-9 and TIMP-1 expression may play an important role in airway inflammation. We aimed to investigate the alveolar clearance by Tc-99m DTPA radioaerosol inhalation scintigraphy in auto painters, to assess effects of exposure to toluene on clearance rate of alveolar epithelium and to determine the correlation between Tc-99m DTPA radioaerosol lung scintigraphy findings and MDA, antioxidant enzymes, MMP-2, MMP-9, TIMP-1 levels. Twenty eight auto painters, and control group were included in the study. Tc-99m DTPA radioaerosol inhalation scintigraphy was performed in all subjects. Clearance half time (T½) and penetration index (PI) on the first minute image were calculated. The mean T½ values and PI of toluene exposed workers were significantly higher than those of control group (P=0.034, P=0.032 respectively). The SOD and GSH-Px levels of auto painters were significantly higher than those of the control group (P=0.016, P=0.003, respectively). Conversely, CAT and MDA levels was not significantly different between groups (P>0.05). We observed a statistically significant increase (P=0.042) in MMP-9 levels of toluene exposed workers compared with the control group, whereas the MMP-2 and TIMP-1 levels of painters were less than those of control group that not reached to statistical significance (P>0.05). A positive correlation was observed between PI and GSH-Px levels (P<0.05) in the painters. There were no correlation between scintigraphic findings and other parameters in any subjects. Our findings indicate that occupational exposure to toluene in auto painters has effect on bronco alveolar epithelial permeability, which is supported by prolonged Tc-99m clearance half time and increased penetration index. We also found increase in antioxidant enzymes and MMP-9 levels. In the light of these findings, it might be concluded that long lasting toluene exposure may lead into occupational lung diseases.

Study objectives: measur the synovial thickness after 166-Holmium radiosynoviorthesis by sonography. Methods: Phases III, prospectiv study. 30 patients suffering from chronic synovitis, rheumatoid arthritis were examined. The protocol commenced with screening. The patients were selected according to inclusion and exclusion criteria. Holmium phytate injectable suspension marked by 600 MBq 166Holmium phytate injectable suspension, and 40 mg of 1 ml triamcinolone acetonide and 1 ml of lidocaine 1%. There were 24 month follow-up period after the administration of the isotope. Inflammatory activity of the affected knee-joint was tested prior to treatment, and the 3 th and 3, 6, 12, 24 and 36 months after treatment. We measured the synovial thickness the following locations: In the midline, lateral and medial, by the condylus of femur medial and lateral. Results: During the study period, inflammation decreased. In the first two years excellent and good results were recorded in 93.3%. Two years after radiosynoviorthesis 93.3% of patients did not need another punction. The thickness of the synovia decreased significantly. We find a significant correlation between the synovial thickness and the clinical improvenes. Conclusion: The 166-Holmium-phytate is an effective new radiopharmacon in the treatment of synovitis. We detect the clinical improvement by sonography. The effective dose is 555-925 MBq.
